channel.title: New Reviews
channel.description: The latest technical/practical reviews from HN-Books

image.title: hn-books: books for hackers recommended by hackers

item.title: A Guide to the Good Life: The Ancient Art of Stoic Joy
item.description: An excellent book for those wanting to optimize their productivity and their life. It teaches how to handle both successes and failures better and achieve tranquility and joy while doing so.
item.author: Daniel@hn-books.com
item.comments: This is the first HN-Books Review.

item.title: The Sparrow
item.description: One of the best sci-fi books of the 1990s, The Sparrow delivers on a lot of hacker goodness
item.author: Daniel@hn-books.com
item.comments: If you want to read sci-fi, this is the best sci-fi I've read in a long time.

item.title: The Art of SEO
item.description: What's the one thing any startup needs? Exposure. Customers. Conversations. SEO is the most powerful way to get those things, and startups that use SEO effectively will do better in the long run than those who don't. Check out the new review and decide for yourself. Also we've added new "add this" buttons to the site. Be sure to try them out and let us know if they work for you!
item.author: Daniel@hn-books.com
item.category: How to tell people about your startup

item.title: Start Small, Stay Small
item.description: This is a book written directly to you hackers out there who have dreams of running your own startup. Sound, practical, great advice I wish somebody had given me when I got started
item.author: Daniel@hn-books.com
item.category: How to run a killer startup

item.title: A Deepness In The Sky
item.description: Great science fiction for hackers. If you want something more than space opera, Vinge delivers. Lots of science, coding, and physics.
item.author: Daniel@hn-books.com

item.title: Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance
item.description: A hacker's book, ZAAM is the story of a man coming to grips with his sanity and being a father, using the only tool he has available: philosophy. A great introduction into philosophy, and a primer on how to integrate technology into your life spiritually.
item.author: Daniel@hn-books.com

item.title: SEOMoz
item.description: If you want to find customers and find out their needs, you're going to have to learn how to attract readers to your site without paying for expensive ads. SEOMoz helps you do that.
item.author: Daniel@hn-books.com
item.category: How to run a killer startup

item.title: The Mythical Man-Month
item.description: One of a very few books that truly stand as a classic in the field, MMM is both a fun romp through how a huge computer project got done 40 years ago and a collection of poignant observations about the mistakes we always make when creating such projects. A foundational read.
item.author: Daniel@hn-books.com
item.category: How to run a killer startup

item.title: Code Complete
item.description: The best book on programming once you learn the mechanics
item.author: Daniel@hn-books.com
item.category: How to be a better programmer

item.title: The Pragmatic Programmer: From Journeyman to Master
item.description: If you know how to code but want to learn how to master being a programmer, this is the book
item.author: Daniel@hn-books.com
item.category: How to be a better programmer

item.title: Slaughterhouse-Five
item.description: Perhaps a little dated from the 1970s, and playing better to a young audience than an older one, Kurt Vonnegut's Slaughterhouse-Five is a sci-fi classic and a must-read rite-of-passage for hackers.
item.author: Daniel@hn-books.com
item.category: How to be a better programmer
